summary: The Finding Opportunities for Resource Exploration Act (Finding ORE Act) directs the Secretary of the Interior to establish memoranda of understanding (MOUs) with foreign countries for scientific and technical cooperation in mapping critical minerals and rare earth elements. The bill prioritizes securing international supply chains, offering US and allied companies right of first refusal for development, facilitating investment, and protecting mapping data. Cooperative activities include data acquisition, resource assessment, scientific collaboration, training, and education. The Secretary must notify Congress, collaborate with the Secretary of State, and consult the private sector.
